attributes.action: Force Birmingham and Leeds city councils to delay the introduction of the ULEZ
attributes.additional_details: Implement a law to prevent schemes such as ULEZ and LEZ that are being implemented this year to be delayed by at least a year or even scrapped altogether until the foreseeable future. This will allow people and businesses to help the country get back on track economically and to reverse the losses we have suffered as a whole.
attributes.background: We want central government to force local government (Birmingham City Council and Leeds Council) to delay the roll out of the Ultra Low Emission Zone by at least 1 year due to the impact it will have on people and businesses recovering from the Covid-19 outbreak.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, Birmingham City Council have delayed the introduction of a ULEZ until the end of 2020 at the earliest due to coronavirus. Leeds City Council have delayed the ULEZ there 'until further notice'. For more information see:

https://airqualitynews.com/2020/03/25/birmingham-delays-launch-of-clean-air-zone-due-to-coronavirus/
https://airqualitynews.com/2020/03/31/leeds-delays-launch-of-clean-air-zone-due-to-coronavirus/

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:  

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips 

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/  

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.  

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
